title: Rubanesque
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417084729im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Scan_5670.jpg)

Can you identify this font??

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Scan.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417084729/http:/typophile.com/files/Scan_4.jpg) | 71.23 KB |
author: evelinat

comments.content:
Have not found a match, so here a couple of similar fonts.  
For the stripe treatment, Chevalier [http://www.identifont.com/find?font=Chevalier&q=Go](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417084729/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=Chevalier&q=Go "http://www.identifont.com/find?font=Chevalier&q=Go")  
For the Q Bernadl [http://www.identifont.com/find?font=berndal&q=Go](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417084729/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=berndal&q=Go "http://www.identifont.com/find?font=berndal&q=Go")  
For general appearance of letterforms Plantin [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/plantin/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417084729/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/plantin/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/plantin/")  
Still looking.  
Don

Further to previous post, here is Plantin Semibold

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417084729im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PlantinSemiboldAsARUB_4960.gif)
  
Perhaps a little closer, News Plantin 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417084729im_/http:/typophile.com/files/NewsPlantinAsARUB_5554.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/news-plantin-mt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417084729/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/news-plantin-mt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/news-plantin-mt/")  
and Times Europa  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417084729im_/http:/typophile.com/files/TimesEuropaAsARUB_6268.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/times-europa/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417084729/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/times-europa/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/times-europa/")  
Don

Hoefler Text appears to be a decent match for the overall letter forms. Perhaps the custom tail on the |Q| and the striping were later additions?:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/hoefler-text/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417084729/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/hoefler-text/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/apple/hoefler-text/")

The website for A. Rubanesque uses Hoefler as a web font....

EDITED:  
Agree, Hoefler Text is a general match

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417084729im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HoeflerTextAsARUB_5312.gif)
  
Also it is used on the website: [http://www.arubanesque.ie/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417084729/http:/www.arubanesque.ie/ "http://www.arubanesque.ie/")  
In my opinion the striped lettering is based on Hoefler Text Engraved Two 
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417084729im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HoeflerTextEngravedTwoAsARUB_6369.jpg)
  
 [http://www.typography.com/fonts/hoefler-text/overview/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417084729/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/hoefler-text/overview/ "http://www.typography.com/fonts/hoefler-text/overview/")  
Don

EDITED:  
A little tinkering with Hoefler Text Engraved Two produces a virtually perfect match

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417084729im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HoeflerTextStripes_R_SM_6357.jpg)
  
Don

Hello guys, I knew it was Hoefler text font. But I can't afford to buy it. They sell only the whole package, not individually.

How about the horizontal stripes? Other hoefler engraved fonts are in vertical stripes.

Thank you again.

As already mentioned, horizontal stripes (along with |Q|’s tail) are a modification done for the logo.  
For suggestions on different engraved typefaces with horizontal stripes, as a start you can follow the very first link provided by Don and look at the list of similar fonts shown.
